sentences.en: A very painful surmise arose concerning her character.
sentences.cn: 对她的人格产生了一种令人难堪的猜度.
罗伯逊的头脑里充满着胡乱的猜测.

sentences.en: Archeologists still can only surmise as to the origin of Man.
sentences.cn: 考古学家们对于人类的起源依然无法推测.

sentences.en: He was afraid she might surmise the truth.
sentences.cn: 他担心她可能会猜出真相.

sentences.en: I surmise that he will take the job.
sentences.cn: 我推测他会接受这份工作.

sentences.en: It is mere surmise that Bosch had Brant's poem in mind when doing this painting.
sentences.cn: 认为博斯在画这幅画时脑子里想着布兰特的诗，这仅仅是猜测而已。

sentences.en: Nor had scandalous surmise the ears the secluded inhabitants of theat St. Leonard's.
sentences.cn: 圣列奥纳德一带与世隔绝的居民们也听不到一点儿流言蜚语.
不是猜测, 而是知识.

sentences.en: Several of Halsey's group commanders were making the same surmise.
sentences.cn: 当时海尔赛空军大队有几位指挥官都作出了同样的揣度.

sentences.en: She had a guilty look which immediately roused surmise in his mind.
sentences.cn: 她那做贼心虚的神色马上引起了他的猜测.

sentences.en: She was right in her surmise.
There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.
sentences.cn: 几乎毫无凭据，我们只能猜测发生了什么。

sentences.en: They surmise that members of this kingdom may be considered the largest organism in the world.
sentences.cn: 他们猜想,这一王国的成员可以被看成是世界上最大的有机体.

sentences.en: We surmise that the delay is caused by some accident.
sentences.cn: 我们猜测这迟延是由某种意外所致.

words.tran_cn: 可以推测得出的，可揣度的

trans.tran_en: If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true
to guess that something is true, using the information you know already
